required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: SARS Cov_2 Incidence of Healthy Health Workers
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of IgG Neutralizing Antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 Among Healthcare Workers Who Frequently Encountered COVID-19 Patients in Our Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Since the severe acute respiratory syndrome Coronavirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2) first emerged in Wuhan, China, on 12 December 2019, it has spread rapidly across the world and developed into a pandemic. The pandemic has affected over 100 countries and regions, with over 132 million confirmed cases of COVID-19. The rapid spread of SARS-CoV-2 has caused considerable harm to public health and the economy. Alongside other laboratory tests and clinical findings of the COVID-19 infection, serological testing may be beneficial for epidemiological monitoring and outbreak control. The determination of antibodies enables confirmation of the SARS-CoV-2 infection in asymptomatic patients in addition to those with typical symptoms. In this study, we aimed to determine the SARS-CoV-2 seroprevalence and the IgG antibody levels among healthcare workers who frequently encountered COVID-19 patients in our hospital.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of IgG Neutralizing Antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 Among Healthcare Workers Who Frequently Encountered COVID-19 patients in Our Hospital
primary_outcome.description: Determining antibody levels and seroprevalence of healthy healthcare workers

clinical_study.condition: SARS COV-2 IgG Levels on Health Workers

arm_group.arm_group_label: SARS Cov_2 Incidence of Healthy Health Workers

intervention.intervention_name: Spike protein (S) or the nucleocapsid (N) of SARS-CoV-2
intervention.description: Blood level of spike protein (S) or the nucleocapsid (N) of SARS-CoV-2
intervention.arm_group_label: SARS Cov_2 Incidence of Healthy Health Workers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Healthy Health Workers - SARS COV-2 PCR (-)
Exclusion Criteria:
Health Workers - SARS COV-2 PCR (+) Pregnancy Autoimmune diseases Received immunosuppressive therapy

facility.name: Adana Dr. Turgut Noyan Application and Research Center
